TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ListView extends Android.Widget.AbsListView

Docs.summary: A view that shows items in a vertically scrolling list.

remarks.para: A view that shows items in a vertically scrolling list. The items come from the associated with this view.
See the List View guide.

public override Android.Widget.IListAdapter Adapter { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Returns the adapter currently in use in this ListView.

remarks.para:
Get method documentation [Android Documentation]
Returns the adapter currently in use in this ListView. The returned adapter might not be the same adapter passed to but might be a .

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Sets the data behind this ListView.
The adapter passed to this method may be wrapped by a , depending on the ListView features currently in use. For instance, adding headers and/or footers will cause the adapter to be wrapped.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void AddFooterView(class Android.Views.View v) cil managed

Docs.summary: Add a fixed view to appear at the bottom of the list.

remarks.para: Add a fixed view to appear at the bottom of the list. If addFooterView is called more than once, the views will appear in the order they were added. Views added using this call can take focus if they want.

Note: When first introduced, this method could only be called before setting the adapter with . Starting with , this method may be called at any time. If the ListView's adapter does not extend , it will be wrapped with a supporting instance of .

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void AddFooterView (Android.Views.View v, Java.Lang.Object data, bool isSelectable);

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool ItemsCanFocus { get; set; }

remarks.para:
Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Indicates that the views created by the ListAdapter can contain focusable items.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Android.Graphics.Drawables.Drawable OverscrollFooter { get; set; }

remarks.para:
Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Sets the drawable that will be drawn below all other list content. This area can become visible when the user overscrolls the list, or when the list's content does not fully fill the container area.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Android.Graphics.Drawables.Drawable OverscrollHeader { get; set; }

remarks.para:
Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Sets the drawable that will be drawn above all other list content. This area can become visible when the user overscrolls the list.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void SetSelection(int32 position) cil managed

Docs.param: Index (starting at 0) of the data item to be selected.
Docs.summary: Sets the currently selected item.

remarks.para: Sets the currently selected item. If in touch mode, the item will not be selected but it will still be positioned appropriately. If the specified selection position is less than 0, then the item at position 0 will be selected.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetSelectionAfterHeaderView() cil managed

Docs.summary: setSelectionAfterHeaderView set the selection to be the first list item after the header views.

remarks.para: setSelectionAfterHeaderView set the selection to be the first list item after the header views.

MemberSignature.Value: public override void SetSelectionFromTop (int p0, int p1);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance void SetSelectionFromTop(int32 p0, int32 p1) cil managed

Docs.param: Index (starting at 0) of the data item to be selected.
The distance from the top edge of the ListView (plus padding) that the item will be positioned.
Docs.summary: Sets the selected item and positions the selection y pixels from the top edge of the ListView.

remarks.para: Sets the selected item and positions the selection y pixels from the top edge of the ListView. (If in touch mode, the item will not be selected but it will still be positioned appropriately.)

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SmoothScrollByOffset(int32 offset) cil managed

Docs.param: The amount to offset from the adapter position to scroll to.
Docs.summary: Smoothly scroll to the specified adapter position offset.

remarks.para: Smoothly scroll to the specified adapter position offset. The view will scroll such that the indicated position is displayed.

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which contains the java.lang.Class JNI value corresponding to this type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.
